substitution.copyText: his antich sword| Rebellious to his arm,
substitution.amendedText: his antique sword| Rebellious to his arm,

substitution.copyText: ''Seeming to feel this blow, with flaming top| ''Stoops to his base, and with a hideous crash| ''Takes prisoner Pyrrhus ear: for loe his sword, ''Which was declining on the milky head| ''Of reverend Priam seem'd i'th air to stick,| ''So as a painted tyrant Pyrrhus stood,| ''Like a neutral to his will and matter,| ''Did nothing
''all you gods| ''In general Synod take away her power, ''Break all the spokes and felloes from her wheel, ''And bowl the round have down the hill of heaven, ''As low as to the fiends.
Ham. It shall to the Barbers with your beard: prethee, say on:| he's for a jig, or a take of bawdry, or he sleeps, say on come to| Hecuba.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. It shall to th' Barbers with your beard. Prethee, say on:| he's for a jig, or a take of bawdry, or he sleeps. Say on come to| Hecuba.

substitution.copyText: About her lank and all o're teamed loyns,
